intro: Sunaptea scabriuscula, commonly known as the roughleaf sunaptea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its rough, textured leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its family.
